# drop(withUpdateRules:)

**Type Method**

Create a verdict that indicates to the system that all of the flow’s data should be dropped, and that the filtering rules have been updated.

## Declaration

```swift
class func drop(withUpdateRules updateRules: Bool) -> NEFilterControlVerdict
```

## Parameters

- **updateRules**: A Boolean indicating whether or not the Filter Control Provider updated the rules.

## Return Value

An `NEFilterControlVerdict` object.

## Discussion

When the Filter Control Provider passes this verdict to the completion handler passed to its [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEFilterControlProvider/handleNewFlow(_:completionHandler:)] method, the system will drop all of the flow’s data. In addition, if the updateRules parameter is YES the system will call the Filter Data Provider’s [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEFilterDataProvider/handleRulesChanged()] method.

## Creating control verdicts

- **allow(withUpdateRules:)**: Create a verdict that indicates to the system that all of the flow’s data should be allowed to pass to its final destination, and that the filtering rules have been updated.
- **updateRules()**: Create a verdict that indicates to the system that the filtering rules have been updated, and that the Filter Data Provider needs to make a decision about the flow’s data.
